name: Dose - Tablet dose
formula: Dose (tablets) = dose prescribed (mg) / dose in stock (mg/tablet)
example:
Calculate the exact amount of medication to give based on available stock. 

Example:
 Metronidazole 750 mg 3 times a day, available tablet 500 mg/tablet

 Tablet Dose:
 = 750 mg/500 mg-tab = 1.5 tablet per dose

name: IV Drip Rate
example:
Determine the number of drops per minute for IV fluids.

Example:
 PNSS 40 ml/hr and drop factor of 20 

 Flow Rate:
 = (40 ml x 20 gtts)/60 minutes
 = 13.33 or 13 gtts/min

name: Infusion Time
example:
Calculate how long it will take for an IV fluid to infuse

Example:
 PNSS 1000 ml at 125 ml/hr

 Infusion Time:
 = 1000 ml / 125 ml/hr
 = 8 hrs

name: Dose - Suspension dose
formula: Suspension Dose (ml) = (dose prescribed mg / dose in stock mg) x stock volume ml
example:
Calculate the exact amount of liquid medication to give in ml. 

Example:
 Amoxicillin 250 mg every 8 hours using a 125 mg/5 ml suspension

 Suspension Dose:
 = (250 mg / 125 mg) x 5 ml
 = 10 ml per dose

name: Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP)
example:
A measure of the average pressure in the arteries and indicator of organ/tissue perfusion. A MAP of >=65 mmHg is recommended in patients with severe sepsis and/or septic shock.

Example:
 Blood pressure of 90/60

 MAP:
 = [90 + (60 x 2)] / 3
 = (90 + 120)/3
 = 210/3
 = 70 mmHg

name: Body Mass Index (BMI)
formula: BMI = weight in kg / (height in meters)²
example:
The ratio of mass to height. Used as a general indicator of whether a person has a healthy body weight for height.

Example:
 Person weighs 50 kgs and is 1.7 meters tall.

 BMI:
 = 70/(1.7)²
 = 70/2.89
 = 24.22
